arm_group.description: Patients that had the WATCHMAN device implanted
patients that had LARIAT LAA device implanted

brief_summary.textblock:
Atrial fibrillation (AF) is the most common cardiac rhythm disorder in clinical practice. In
      the last two decades the number of hospitalizations for AF has increased two- to three-fold.
      More than 6 million people worldwide suffer from atrial fibrillation (AF), a cardiac
      disorder that results in systemic emboli. Patients with AF are 5 times more likely to have a
      stroke compared with those without AF.

      This registry will collection information on two devices that are used to treat AF.  The
      WATCHMAN and LARIAT.  The differences in techniques and subsequent effects of the two
      devices on outcomes related to AF has not been studied. This study will look to compare the
      two devices to see how the outcomes may vary.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Left Atrial Appendage Occlusion Devices

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who have had a LARIAT LAA device occlusion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Patients who have PFO/ASD/critical carotid artery (>70% blockage) disease and
             hemorrhagic strokes

study_pop.textblock: Patients who have had a LARIAT LAA device occlusion.

intervention.description: The LARIAT snare device is an over-the-wire device guided over the LAA to enable ligation of the LAA. The LARIAT can be opened and closed as desired for ideal positioning without risk of suture deployment.

The WATCHMAN is an expandable device deployed in the LAA via a trans-septal catheter. The implanted device has a self-expanding nitinol frame to secure it in the LAA. The fabric of the WATCHMAN device is permeable to blood.

clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Safety and Efficacy of Left Atrial Appendage Occlusion Devices

primary_outcome.description: This registry will provide data on patient outcomes at different times during follow up. This includes: changes in the appendage size, shape and patients medical history.
primary_outcome.measure: Effect of LAA occlusion by LARIAT device

primary_outcome.description: This registry will provide data on patient outcomes at different times during follow up.This includes: changes in the appendage size, shape and patients medical history.
primary_outcome.measure: Effect of LAA occlusion by LARIAT device

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: University of Kansas Medical Center Research Institute

secondary_outcome.measure: Compare effectiveness of LAA occlusion procedure by evaluating LAA jet velocities

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case Control, Time Perspective: Retrospective
